cache_entry_t* cache_inode_create ( cache_entry_t *  pentry_parent,
fsal_name_t *  pname,

fsal_attrib_list_t *  pattr,
hash_table_t *  ht,
cache_inode_client_t *  pclient,
fsal_op_context_t *  pcontext,
cache_inode_status_t *  pstatus 
)

cache_inode_create: creates an entry through the cache.

Creates an entry through the cache.

Parameters:
pentry_parent [IN] pointer to the pentry parent
pname [IN] pointer to the name of the object in the destination directory.
type [IN] type of the object to be created.
mode [IN] mode to be used at file creation
pcreate_arg [IN] additional argument for object creation
pattr [OUT] attributes for the new object.
ht [INOUT] hash table used for the cache.
pclient [INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
pcontext [IN] FSAL credentials
pstatus [OUT] returned status.
Returns:
CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry
CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE either source or destination have incorrect type
CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS entry of that name already exists in destination.

Definition at line 86 of file cache_inode_create.c.

cache_entry_t* cache_inode_create_open ( cache_entry_t *  pentry_parent,
fsal_name_t *  pname,

)

cache_inode_create_open: creates a file and opens it at the same time (for NFSv4 semantics)

Creates an entry through the cache.

Parameters:
pentry_parent [IN] pointer to the pentry parent
pname [IN] pointer to the name of the object in the destination directory.
type [IN] type of the object to be created.
mode [IN] mode to be used at file creation
openflags [IN] flags to be used during file open
pcreate_arg [IN] additional argument for object creation
pattr [OUT] attributes for the new object.
ht [INOUT] hash table used for the cache.
pclient [INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
pcontext [IN] FSAL credentials
pstatus [OUT] returned status.
Returns:
CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS if operation is a success
CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR if allocation error occured when validating the entry
CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE either source or destination have incorrect type
CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS entry of that name already exists in destination.
